in_ports.description: Two strings to be compared. Indexed from 0 to 1.
in_ports.name: IN[2]

members.description: Amount of bytes to be compared between strings. If zero, the whole strings will be compared.
members.name: bytes

out_ports.description: It returns an integer less than, equal to, or greater than zero if string received on IN[0] is found to be less than, to match, or be greater than string on IN[1].
out_ports.name: OUT

out_ports.description: TRUE if the string received on IN[0] is the same as the string on IN[1].
out_ports.name: EQUAL

in_ports.description: Two strings to be concatenated. Indexed from 0 to 1.
in_ports.name: IN[2]

members.description: Amount of bytes to be copied from string received on IN[1]. If zero, the whole string will be concatenated to the string received on IN[0]
members.name: bytes

members.description: Separator string to be used between the two concatenated strings. It's set to null by default (no separator).
members.name: separator

out_ports.description: String IN[0] concatenated to string IN[1].
out_ports.name: OUT

types.description: Calculate the length of a string

in_ports.description: String to be measured.
in_ports.name: IN

types.name: string/length

members.description: Maximum length to be checked. If a string is greater than that, maxlen value will be sent. If zero, no limit is applied.
members.name: maxlen

out_ports.description: Send the string size, the number of bytes excluding terminating null byte. If maxlen is provided, it'll be at most this value.
out_ports.name: OUT

types.description: Split a string given a separator.

in_ports.description: String to be split.
in_ports.name: IN

in_ports.description: String received on 'IN' port will be split using these delimiter chars.
in_ports.name: SEPARATOR

in_ports.description: A string can be split in many substrings. This value defines which substring should be sent. It must be non-negative.
in_ports.name: INDEX

in_ports.description: A string can be split in many substrings. This value defines the maximum number of splits (separated by the separator option) to generate, and must be non-negative.
in_ports.name: MAX_SPLIT

types.name: string/split

members.description: A string can be split in many substrings. This value defines which substring should be sent. It must be non-negative. It can be overriden by values received on 'INDEX' port.
members.name: index

members.description: A string can be split in many substrings. This value defines the maximum number of splits (separated by the separator option) to generate, and must be non-negative. The default value of zero means to generate all substrings between the given separator. This option can be overriden by values received on the 'MAX_SPLIT' port.
members.name: max_split

members.description: String received on 'IN' port will be split using these delimiters chars. It can be overriden by values received on 'SEPARATOR' port.
members.name: separator

out_ports.description: Substring given a separator and an index.
out_ports.name: OUT

types.description: Given an input string, output a copy with all original characters in lower case.

in_ports.description: String to be output in lowercase
in_ports.name: IN

types.name: string/lowercase

out_ports.description: The original input string now in lowercase characters
out_ports.name: OUT

types.description: Given an input string, output a copy with all original characters in upper case.

in_ports.description: String to be output in uppercase
in_ports.name: IN

types.name: string/uppercase

out_ports.description: The original input string now in uppercase characters
out_ports.name: OUT

types.description: Replace a pattern in a string for another.

in_ports.description: String to be replaced.
in_ports.name: IN

in_ports.description: The string received on the 'IN' port will have substrings defined by this port replaced by the ones defined in the 'TO' port.
in_ports.name: FROM

in_ports.description: The string received on the 'IN' port will have substrings defined by the 'FROM' port replaced by the ones defined in this port.
in_ports.name: TO

in_ports.description: A string can have a substring replaced in many points. This value defines the maximum number of replacements to attempt, and must be non-negative.
in_ports.name: MAX_REPLACE

types.name: string/replace

members.description: A string can have a substring replaced in many points. This value defines the maximum number of replacements to attempt, and must be non-negative.. The default value of zero means to replace all possible substrings. This option can be overriden by values received on the 'MAX_REPLACE' port.
members.name: max_replace

members.description: The string received on the 'IN' port will have substrings defined by this option replaced by the ones defined by the 'to_string' one. It can be overriden by values received on 'FROM' port.
members.name: from_string

members.description: Whether to only forward the input string as is to the output port when no matches occur (true) or to generate error packets (false)
members.name: forward_on_no_match

members.description: The string received on the 'IN' port will have substrings defined by the 'from_string' option replaced by the ones defined by this one. It can be overriden by values received on 'TO' port.
members.name: to_string

out_ports.description: The original string coming in the 'IN' port with the due replacements made.
out_ports.name: OUT

types.description: Search a given regular expression pattern on a given string. This node expects the same syntax and semantics as Perl 5 on regular expressions. When dealing the UTF-8 characters, remember to use the 'p{}' family of escape sequences (Unicode character properties).

in_ports.description: String to be searched.
in_ports.name: IN

in_ports.description: Regular expression pattern to search the string received on 'IN' port with.
in_ports.name: REGEXP

in_ports.description: This value defines which substring match (by index, starting from 0) inside the one that was fed to the 'IN' port should be output in the 'OUT' port. It must be non-negative. The first substring will always identify the portion of the subject string matched by the entire pattern. The next one will be the first capturing subpattern, and so on.
in_ports.name: INDEX

in_ports.description: The regular expression matching against the input string can result in various substring matches. This value defines the maximum number of them to generate and make available for selection by the 'INDEX' port. It must be non-negative.
in_ports.name: MAX_REGEXP_SEARCH

types.name: string/regexp-search

members.description: This value defines which substring match (by index, starting from 0) inside the one that was fed to the 'IN' port should be output in the 'OUT' port. It must be non-negative. It can be overriden by values received on 'INDEX' port.
members.name: index

members.description: The regular expression matching against the input string can result in various substring matches. This value defines the maximum number of them to generate and make available for selection by the 'INDEX' port. This option can be overriden by values received on the 'MAX_REGEXP_SEARCH' port. The value of zero (default one) will be interpreted as to generate all possible matches.
members.name: max_regexp_search

members.description: Regular expression pattern to search the string received on 'IN' port with. It can be overriden by values received on 'REGEXP' port.
members.name: regexp

out_ports.description: Number of regular expression match substrings. The first substring will always identify the portion of the subject string matched by the entire pattern. The next one will be the first capturing subpattern, and so on.
out_ports.name: LENGTH

out_ports.description: Outputs the regular expression match substring at the selected index. With regard to indeces, the first substring (index 0) will always identify the portion of the subject string matched by the entire pattern. The next one will be the first capturing subpattern, and so on.
out_ports.name: OUT

types.description: Replace a regular expression pattern in a string for another. This node expects the same syntax and semantics as Perl 5 on regular expressions. When dealing the UTF-8 characters, remember to use the 'p{}' family of escape sequences (Unicode character properties).

in_ports.description: String to be replaced.
in_ports.name: IN

in_ports.description: Regular expression pattern to match the string received on 'IN' port with. If groups are used, they may be referred back on the string coming in the 'TO' port.
in_ports.name: REGEXP

in_ports.description: String substitution for the pattern match (may be a regular expression as well). Groups present on the string provided to the port 'REGEXP' may be referred here on the substitution.
in_ports.name: TO

in_ports.description: The regular expression matching against the input string can result in various substring matches. This value defines the maximum number of them to exchange for the string given in the 'TO' port. It must be non-negative.
in_ports.name: MAX_REGEXP_REPLACE

types.name: string/regexp-replace

members.description: The regular expression matching against the input string can result in various substring matches. This value defines the maximum number of them to replace for the string given in the 'to' option. This option can be overriden by values received on the 'MAX_REGEXP_REPLACE' port. The value of zero (default one) will be interpreted as to replace all possible matches.
members.name: max_regexp_replace

members.description: Regular expression pattern to match the string received on 'IN' port with. If groups are used, they may be referred back on the string coming in the 'TO' port. It must not be an empty string. It may be overriden by values received on 'REGEXP' port.
members.name: regexp

members.description: String substitution for the pattern match. Groups present on the string provided to the port 'REGEXP' may be referred here on the substitution (e.g. \\g1 or \\1 for the first matching group). It may be an empty string. It can be overriden by values received on 'TO' port.
members.name: to

members.description: Whether to only forward the input string as is to the output port when no matches occur (true) or to generate error packets (false)
members.name: forward_on_no_match

out_ports.description: The original string coming in the 'IN' port with the due replacements made.
out_ports.name: OUT
